content: fyi - Crates.io is moving to HTTP index - https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io/pull/4661 - to me it looks like atomic query/response index instead of clone operation that the GH one operated as. Each dependency on GH stored only 1st degree dependencies but unsure what the new design will be -
I would love to test dependency-circular-bomb and see just how twisted / hostile dependency tree I could build

I've asked whether the new index could store the whole graph of dependency tree as single request / response resource - https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/318791-t-crates-io/topic/HTTP.20based.20index/near/277978242 - (also fyi crates.io team seems to be moving to zulip from DIscord)
The git index is not going away.
